meanings.sent1: He made a shmucky mistake by forgetting his keys again.
meanings.sent2: She felt a bit shmucky after realizing she had missed the important meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat's shmucky decision to chase its own tail amused the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The idea of jumping into the pool fully clothed seemed quite shmucky to her.
meanings.sent5: The clown's shmucky behavior made the children giggle uncontrollably.

meanings.definition: Behaving in an annoying or irritating manner
meanings.sent1: Her constant interruptions were starting to feel really shmucky.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the party next door was really shmucky.
meanings.sent3: The way he kept tapping his pen on the desk was getting quite shmucky.
meanings.sent4: The buzzing sound of the mosquito was incredibly shmucky in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive beeping of the alarm clock was becoming increasingly shmucky to her ears.

meanings.definition: A person who is disliked or considered unpleasant
meanings.sent1: He always acts like a real shmucky around others.
meanings.sent2: The new student turned out to be a bit of a shmucky in class.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy neighbor was known as the neighborhood's biggest shmucky.
meanings.sent4: She avoided sitting next to the office shmucky during lunch break.
meanings.sent5: The boss's constant criticism made him feel like the office shmucky.
